title: Ticket #4348: CONDOR_IDS should be ignored if not running as root
description: When running with root priv, CONDOR_IDS tells condor what UID/GID to use during normal operation. However, if you start condor without root, it should really have no effect. For the most part, that's true, but a call to get_real_condor_uid() returns the value from CONDOR_IDS even though this can never be the case, as a non-root install can't switch to said UID. This can lead to problems operating on jobs because OwnerCheck will fail, and the resulting message is entirely non-obvious. There's no good reason that I can think of to look at CONDOR_IDS in a non-root install, and as such I propose to modify the code so it is ignore in such a scenario.
creator: zmiller
